original_solution_mapping.L1: So far, Mary has paid back $15 +$23=$<<15+23=38>>38 of the credit.
original_solution_mapping.L2: So she still needs to pay $100-$38=$<<100-38=62>>62

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 24.
    Returns: the amount of credit Mary needs to pay before her next shopping trip.
    """
    # L1
    paid_tuesday = 15 # paid $15 of it on Tuesday
    paid_thursday = 23 # paid $23 of it on Thursday
    total_paid = paid_tuesday + paid_thursday

    # L2
    credit_limit = 100 # credit of $100
    remaining_to_pay = credit_limit - total_paid

    # FA
    answer = remaining_to_pay
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: So far, Mary has paid back ${paid_tuesday} +${paid_thursday}=$<<{paid_tuesday}+{paid_thursday}={total_paid}>>{total_paid} of the credit.
So she still needs to pay ${credit_limit}-${total_paid}=$<<{credit_limit}-{total_paid}={remaining_to_pay}>>{remaining_to_pay}

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: So far, Mary has paid back $15 +$23=$<<15+23=38>>38 of the credit.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: So she still needs to pay $100-$15=$<<100-15=85>>85

explanation: Incorrect operand. The variable 'paid_tuesday' (value: 15) was used instead of 'total_paid' (value: 38).
